lead_paragraph: Three South American riders were suspended from competing yesterday at the world road championships in Salzburg, Austria, because of irregular blood levels, although the ban did not mean they were caught doping. Tests before the event showed excessive hematocrit levels for Martin Garrido and Matias Medici of Argentina, and Magno Nazaret of Brazil. They were not allowed to race for two weeks. In all, 18 riders were tested from Brazil, Argentina, Australia, the United States and Switzerland. Hematocrit testing checks the percentage of a person’s packed red blood cells.
